verses.plain: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

tokens.t: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us,
work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

verses.plain: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

tokens.t: thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them;
thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

verses.plain: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

tokens.t: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

verses.plain: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

tokens.t: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

verses.plain: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

tokens.t: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

verses.plain: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

tokens.t: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

verses.plain: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

tokens.t: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

verses.plain: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

tokens.t: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

verses.plain: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

tokens.t: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

verses.plain: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

tokens.t: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

verses.plain: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

tokens.t: Thou hast given us like sheep
for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verses.plain: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.

tokens.t: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase
by their price.

verses.plain: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

tokens.t: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

verses.plain: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

tokens.t: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

verses.plain: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

tokens.t: My confusion
continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

verses.plain: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

tokens.t: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

verses.plain: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

tokens.t: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

verses.plain: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

tokens.t: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

verses.plain: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

tokens.t: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.plain: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

tokens.t: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

verses.plain: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

tokens.t: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

verses.plain: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

tokens.t: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

verses.plain: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

tokens.t: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast
not off for ever.

verses.plain: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

tokens.t: Wherefore hidest thou thy face,
forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

verses.plain: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

tokens.t: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

verses.plain: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.

tokens.t: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.

footnotes.text: like…: Heb. as sheep of meat
for our…: Heb. a help for us
